<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 376, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 A Level Structured Questions  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 220, 602]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 100.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 74, 128, 91]]<|/det|>
## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 103, 625, 532]]<|/det|>
acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81 \text{m s}^{- 2}\) speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00 \times 10^{8} \text{m s}^{- 1}\) elementary charge \(e = 1.60 \times 10^{- 19} \text{C}\) unified atomic mass unit \(1 \text{u} = 1.66 \times 10^{- 27} \text{kg}\) rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67 \times 10^{- 27} \text{kg}\) rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11 \times 10^{- 31} \text{kg}\) Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02 \times 10^{23} \text{mol}^{- 1}\) molar gas constant \(R = 8.31 \text{J K}^{- 1} \text{mol}^{- 1}\) Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38 \times 10^{- 23} \text{J K}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant \(G = 6.67 \times 10^{- 11} \text{N m}^{2} \text{kg}^{- 2}\) permittivity of free space \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85 \times 10^{- 12} \text{F m}^{- 1}\) \(\left(\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99 \times 10^{9} \text{m F}^{- 1}\right)\) Planck constant \(h = 6.63 \times 10^{- 34} \text{J s}\) Stefan- Boltzmann constant \(\sigma = 5.67 \times 10^{- 8} \text{W m}^{- 2} \text{K}^{- 4}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 567, 170, 583]]<|/det|>
## Formulae  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 599, 324, 616]]<|/det|>
uniformly accelerated motion  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 650, 252, 667]]<|/det|>
hydrostatic pressure  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 682, 154, 699]]<|/det|>
upthrust  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 723, 341, 741]]<|/det|>
Doppler effect for sound waves  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 761, 208, 778]]<|/det|>
electric current  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 793, 230, 810]]<|/det|>
resistors in series  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 828, 240, 846]]<|/det|>
resistors in parallel  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 101, 620, 121]]<|/det|>
\[g = 9.81 \text{m s}^{-2}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 131, 620, 151]]<|/det|>
\[c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{-1}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 163, 606, 182]]<|/det|>
\[e = 1.60\times 10^{-19}\mathrm{C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 193, 610, 213]]<|/det|>
\[1 \text{u} = 1.66 \times 10^{-27} \text{kg}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 225, 610, 245]]<|/det|>
\[m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{-27}\mathrm{kg}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 255, 610, 275]]<|/det|>
\[m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{-31}\mathrm{kg}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 285, 628, 306]]<|/det|>
\[N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{-1}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 317, 610, 336]]<|/det|>
\[R = 8.31\mathrm{~J~K}^{-1}\mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 348, 630, 368]]<|/det|>
\[k = 1.38\times 10^{-23}\mathrm{~J~K}^{-1}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 380, 670, 400]]<|/det|>
\[G = 6.67\times 10^{-11}\mathrm{Nm}^2\mathrm{kg}^{-2}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 410, 635, 465]]<|/det|>
\[\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{-12}\mathrm{Fm}^{-1}\] \[(\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{-1})\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 475, 615, 495]]<|/det|>
\[h = 6.63\times 10^{-34}\mathrm{~J~s}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 505, 668, 526]]<|/det|>
\[\sigma = 5.67\times 10^{-8}\mathrm{Wm}^{-2}\mathrm{K}^{-4}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 600, 562, 636]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 650, 530, 668]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta p = \rho g\Delta h\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 680, 522, 699]]<|/det|>
\[F = \rho gV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 712, 536, 747]]<|/det|>
\[f_0 = \frac{f_sV}{V\pm V_s}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 759, 532, 778]]<|/det|>
\[I = A n v q\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 790, 588, 810]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 820, 599, 855]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1}{R} = \frac{1}{R_{1}} +\frac{1}{R_{2}} +\ldots\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 79, 539, 100]]<|/det|>
gravitational potential \(\phi = - \frac{GM}{r}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 121, 554, 144]]<|/det|>
gravitational potential energy \(E_{\mathrm{P}} = - \frac{GMm}{r}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 165, 571, 189]]<|/det|>
pressure of an ideal gas \(p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V}\langle c^2\rangle\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 201, 539, 220]]<|/det|>
simple harmonic motion \(a = - \omega^2 x\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 233, 570, 252]]<|/det|>
velocity of particle in s.h.m. \(\nu = \nu_0 \cos \omega t\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 250, 615, 276]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(x_0^2 - x^2)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 292, 544, 314]]<|/det|>
electric potential \(V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_0r}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 336, 544, 364]]<|/det|>
electrical potential energy \(E_{\mathrm{P}} = \frac{Qq}{4\pi\epsilon_0r}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 384, 601, 413]]<|/det|>
capacitors in series \(\frac{1}{C} = \frac{1}{C_1} + \frac{1}{C_2} + \dots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 426, 594, 445]]<|/det|>
capacitors in parallel \(C = C_1 + C_2 + \dots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 466, 556, 485]]<|/det|>
discharge of a capacitor \(x = x_0 \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{t}{RC}}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 508, 524, 536]]<|/det|>
Hall voltage \(V_{\mathrm{H}} = \frac{BI}{nq}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 549, 561, 567]]<|/det|>
alternating current/voltage \(x = x_0 \sin \omega t\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 580, 539, 598]]<|/det|>
radioactive decay \(x = x_0 \mathrm{e}^{-\lambda t}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 612, 544, 641]]<|/det|>
decay constant \(\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 664, 576, 702]]<|/det|>
intensity reflection coefficient \(\frac{I_{\mathrm{R}}}{I_0} = \frac{(Z_1 - Z_2)^2}{(Z_1 + Z_2)^2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 718, 556, 737]]<|/det|>
Stefan–Boltzmann law \(L = 4\pi \sigma r^2 T^4\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 758, 556, 782]]<|/det|>
Doppler redshift \(\frac{\Delta \lambda}{\lambda} \approx \frac{\Delta f}{f} \approx \frac{\nu}{c}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 433, 89]]<|/det|>
State Newton's law of gravitation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 194, 144, 212]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 194, 920, 227]]<|/det|>
A satellite is in a circular orbit around a planet. The radius of the orbit is \(R\) and the period of the orbit is \(T\). The planet is a uniform sphere.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 240, 712, 259]]<|/det|>
Use Newton's law of gravitation to show that \(R\) and \(T\) are related by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 271, 564, 290]]<|/det|>
\[4\pi^{2}R^{3} = GMT^{2}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 303, 727, 322]]<|/det|>
where \(M\) is the mass of the planet and \(G\) is the gravitational constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 477, 920, 496]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 508, 144, 526]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 508, 920, 541]]<|/det|>
The Earth may be considered to be a uniform sphere of mass \(5.98 \times 10^{24} \text{kg}\) and radius \(6.37 \times 10^{6} \text{m}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 553, 583, 572]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 584, 902, 603]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 382, 405, 401]]<|/det|>

<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A heavy aluminium disc has a radius of \(0.36 \text{m}\). The disc rotates with the wheels of a vehicle and forms part of an electromagnetic braking system on the vehicle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 912, 152]]<|/det|>
In order to activate the braking system, a uniform magnetic field of flux density \(0.17 \text{T}\) is switched on. This magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of rotation of the disc, as shown in Fig. 6.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 173, 848, 437]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[462, 466, 532, 485]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 6.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 498, 144, 516]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 498, 185, 516]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 498, 371, 516]]<|/det|>
Define magnetic flux.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 621, 180, 640]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 621, 804, 640]]<|/det|>
Calculate the magnetic flux through the disc. Give a unit with your answer.
